hints.content: First, we need to find $5 \dfrac12$ inches on the number line.

$5\dfrac12$ is after $5$ but before $6$.

[[☃ image 1]]

There are $4$ equal parts, or fourths, between each whole. We can use equivalent fractions to label each tick.

[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: A line plot that has, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 5 and 6. Between the labeled tick marks are three equally-spaced unlabeled tick marks. !

A line plot that has, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 5, 5 and one-fourth, 5 and one-half, 5 and three-fourths, and 6. The 5 and one-half tick mark is marked with a vertical dotted line. !

hints.content:
Each dot represents one caterpillar. 

So, we need to count all of the dots on the line plot that represent lengths greater than $5 \dfrac12$ inches.  

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A line plot labeled Caterpillar lengths (inches) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10. Three unlabeled tick marks appear between each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 2 dots above 4, 4 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 4, 2 dots above the third unlabeled tick mark after 4, 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 5, 2 dots above 6, 3 dots above 7, 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 8, and 2 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 9. The 5 and one-half tick mark is marked with a vertical dotted line. The dots to the right of the vertical dotted line (to the right of 5 and 1 half inches) are all highlighted. !

hints.content:
There are $\blueD8$ dots that represent lengths greater than $5 \dfrac12$ inches.   

$\blueD8$ caterpillars are longer than $5 \dfrac12$ inches.

question.content:
The lengths of some caterpillars are shown below.  

[[☃ image 1]]

**How many caterpillars are longer than $5 \dfrac12$ inches?** 
 
[[☃ input-number 1]] caterpillars

options.alt: A line plot labeled Caterpillar lengths (inches) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10. Three unlabeled tick marks appear between each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 2 dots above 4, 4 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 4, 2 dots above the third unlabeled tick mark after 4, 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 5, 2 dots above 6, 3 dots above 7, 1 dot above the first unlabeled tick mark after 8, and 2 dots above the second unlabeled tick mark after 9. !
